Introduction

DUSTIN is a South Korean boy group under Na Entertainment (formerly known as LPA and Namoo Entertainment). The group debuted on January 6, 2020, with the digital single ‘Burn‘ as a seven-member lineup with Kim Yoon, Hwani, Siu, Seung Han, JJ, Bel, and Daon.

On July 27, 2020, a teaser was posted revealing their first sub-unit consisting of JJ, Bel, and Daon, which was called DUSTIN-ON and debuted on August 17, 2020, with the mini album '0:Young'.

The agency announced on March 1, 2021, that they would add two new members to the lineup: Sunho and Dojun.

On May 24, 2021, Na Entertainment announced the group's disbandment due to internal circumstances. However, a few months later, more precisely on December 26, 2021, the agency teased a return for the group on their social media. Only two members of the original lineup, Siu and Seung Han, were still active on the group account at that time and it was believed all the other members had left the company.

New members were added starting February 2022 with Mini being the first one on February 3, followed by Win on February 10, Lake on February 17, and Seunggi on February 24. Later, an official group photo was released, confirming that Seung Han had also left the group.

Mini left the group sometime in January 2023 while Win took a hiatus in February due to health issues and later left the group.

On February 10, 2023, DUSTIN announced they would debut a sub-unit with four new members. Three days later, Daon rejoined the group and two days after that, Alex, Raphael, and MJ were introduced as the new members. However, MJ never debuted with the group due to his parents' opposition.

Alex took a hiatus for health reasons and left the group sometime in late 2023. Daon also left for health reasons on April 8, 2024.

Currently, the lineup consists of four members: Siu, Lake, Seunggi, and Raphael. Siu being the only member from the original lineup to still be in the group.
